logic.assemblyline

Class AssemblyLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.assemblyline.AssemblyLine

  • public class AssemblyLine
extends java.lang.Object
    Class handling an assembly line of a car manufacturing company.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AssemblyLine()
      Initializes the workstations, the schedule and the queue containing the orders.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssemblyLine

        public AssemblyLine()
        Initializes the workstations, the schedule and the queue containing the orders. Also sets the current time to January first 2014 at the beginning of the shift.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentTime

        public org.joda.time.DateTime getCurrentTime()
        Asks the current time of the system.
        Returns:
        The current time of the system.

      • moveAssemblyLine

        public boolean moveAssemblyLine(int phaseDuration)
        First checks if the phaseDuration is between 0 and 180 minutes. Moves the car orders on the assembly line if every work station is ready and sets the end time of the first order to the given end time if there was an order in the last workstation. Then checks if it's the end of the day. If it is the end of the day, sets the time to the next day at the beginning of the shift and updates the estimated time of the car orders. It also calculates the overtime made during that day. Else just updates the estimated time of the car orders.
        Parameters:
        phaseDuration - The time in minutes representing the duration of the current phase.
        Returns:
        False if the assembly line can not be moved. True otherwise.

      • progressTime

        public void progressTime(int phaseDuration)

      • getWorkStations

        public Workstation[] getWorkStations()
        Asks a list of workstations available.
        Returns:
        The list of workstations.

      • addCarOrder

        public void addCarOrder(CarOrder order)
        Calls the schedule and asks to schedule the given car order.
        Parameters:
        order - The car order to be scheduled.

      • askFutureSchedule

        public java.util.List<CarOrder> askFutureSchedule()
        Returns a list of 3 car orders which would be in the workstations if the assembly is moved by the manager.
        Returns:
        A list of car orders which would be in the workstations if the assembly line should move.
